page.title: 04The Church's Saxon Door.
page.content: The south door has been dated at 1040 which means that it displays some of the oldest ironwork in England. It tells the story of Ragnorak THE NORSE DAY OF JUDGEMENT which starts with a cockrel crowing while a night watchman blows his horn to call the Gods to a battle.The seals rush onto the land and Midgard,the serpent,grows until he can encircle the world.Other monsters fight the Ship of the Dead which the Gods are on.Thorsur,the Sunwheel,throws sheets of flame over the earth.The stars fall from the heavens while above flies Nithoggr,who feeds on the slain.However,above him is a cross the symbol of a new hope coming, and a Christian end to the Norse legend.The door has recently been away at an exhibition but is now back in its place in the south doorway of the church.
